title: New Laptop Comparison
description: Compare laptops to find your perfect machine

criteria.name: Performance
criteria.description: CPU, RAM, and processing power for your tasks

criteria.name: Battery Life
criteria.description: Hours of real-world usage between charges

criteria.name: Value for Money
criteria.description: Price relative to features and performance

alternatives.name: Apple MacBook Air 13-inch (M3 Chip, 2024)
alternatives.description: The latest MacBook Air with the M3 chip offers exceptional performance and battery life in a thin, lightweight design, perfect for students and professionals.

alternatives.name: Dell XPS 13 Plus (9320, 13th Gen Intel)
alternatives.description: A premium ultrabook with a sleek, borderless InfinityEdge display, innovative capacitive touch function row, and powerful Intel processors.
pros: Excellent keyboard and large haptic touchpad
cons: Battery life is good but not class-leading
No headphone jack on some configurations
Capacitive function keys can be less tactile

alternatives.name: Lenovo Yoga 9i Gen 9 (14-inch, 2024)
alternatives.description: A versatile 2-in-1 convertible laptop with a stunning OLED display, premium soundbar hinge, and robust performance for creative work.
pros: Premium build with unique soundbar hinge for better audio
Good mix of performance and portability
cons: Battery life is average due to OLED display
Can run warm under heavy load

alternatives.name: ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 (2024, GA403)
alternatives.description: A powerful yet portable gaming laptop with an AMD Ryzen AI processor and dedicated NVIDIA graphics, packed into a compact 14-inch chassis.
pros: Excellent gaming and creative performance in a small form factor
AniMe Matrix LED lid customization (on some models)
cons: Battery life drops significantly during gaming
Webcam is only 1080p (no Windows Hello facial recognition)

criterion-0.explanation: The M3 chip delivers exceptional CPU performance and efficiency, handling demanding tasks effortlessly while remaining cool and quiet. With unified memory architecture, even base configurations feel responsive for most professional workflows.

criterion-1.explanation: The Liquid Retina display offers excellent color accuracy and sharp 2560x1664 resolution, though brightness (500 nits) falls short of Pro models. It lacks ProMotion high refresh rate, which is noticeable during scrolling and motion.

criterion-2.explanation: Outstanding 15-18 hours of real-world usage sets the standard for ultraportables. The M3's efficiency enables all-day productivity without power anxiety, significantly outperforming most Windows competitors.

criterion-3.explanation: Unibody aluminum construction feels premium and durable with excellent fit and finish. The thin, lightweight design maintains structural rigidity better than most plastic or hybrid competitors.

criterion-4.explanation: Starting price is high for base configuration (8GB RAM, 256GB SSD), and upgrades are expensive. While performance is excellent, entry-level models have storage and memory limitations that reduce long-term value.

criterion-5.explanation: At 2.7 pounds and 0.44 inches thick, it's exceptionally lightweight and slim without compromising screen size. The compact form factor makes it ideal for frequent travelers and mobile professionals.

criterion-0.explanation: The 13th Gen Intel processors deliver strong performance for productivity and light creative work, though thermal throttling can limit sustained heavy workloads. RAM options up to 32GB provide good multitasking capability.

criterion-1.explanation: The InfinityEdge display offers exceptional resolution, color accuracy, and brightness with minimal bezels. It's among the best laptop screens available, suitable for professional content work.

criterion-2.explanation: Battery life is disappointing for an ultrabook, typically lasting 5-7 hours in real-world use. The high-resolution display and compact chassis limit endurance compared to competitors.

criterion-3.explanation: Premium CNC machined aluminum construction feels exceptionally solid and durable. The minimalist design and precise manufacturing represent top-tier laptop build quality.

criterion-4.explanation: Significant price premium for design and display quality that may not justify cost for budget-conscious buyers. Comparable performance can be found at lower price points.

criterion-5.explanation: Extremely compact and lightweight design makes it excellent for travel, though the minimal port selection (only USB-C) requires adapters for many peripherals.

criterion-0.explanation: Equipped with Intel Core Ultra processors and up to 32GB RAM, it handles creative workloads and multitasking well, though not quite at the level of dedicated workstation laptops.

criterion-1.explanation: The 14-inch OLED panel offers exceptional contrast, vibrant colors, and high resolution, making it outstanding for media consumption and creative work.

criterion-2.explanation: OLED displays are power-hungry, and real-world usage typically yields only 5-7 hours, which is below average for a modern laptop.

criterion-3.explanation: Premium aluminum chassis, robust hinge with integrated soundbar, and excellent fit-and-finish give it a truly premium and durable feel.

criterion-4.explanation: While feature-rich, it commands a premium price; you pay for the convertible design and OLED display rather than raw performance per dollar.

criterion-5.explanation: At around 3.5 lbs and a slim 14-inch form factor, it's highly portable, though not the absolute lightest in its class.

criterion-0.explanation: The AMD Ryzen AI processor combined with dedicated NVIDIA graphics delivers exceptional performance for gaming, content creation, and multitasking. The combination of high-end CPU and GPU in this form factor is outstanding.

criterion-1.explanation: The 14-inch display typically offers high refresh rates and good color accuracy suitable for gaming and media consumption. While excellent, some professional-grade laptops offer superior color calibration and brightness.

criterion-2.explanation: Despite efficiency improvements, the powerful components significantly drain battery during intensive use. Real-world gaming or creative work yields limited unplugged runtime compared to ultraportables.

criterion-3.explanation: The magnesium-aluminum chassis feels premium and durable with good structural integrity. Some competing devices in this category offer slightly more refined construction and materials.

criterion-4.explanation: While packed with premium components, the price reflects its high-end positioning. You're paying for the compact form factor with gaming performance, making it less cost-effective than larger gaming laptops.

criterion-5.explanation: Exceptional portability for a gaming laptop - the 14-inch chassis and relatively light weight make it genuinely travel-friendly. Few devices pack this much power into such a compact form factor.
